intro: Lebeckia cytisoides, commonly known as the silverleaf lebeckia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in spring. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
